There are about 3 people on this whole forum who agree that going to war in Iraq was fine, who agree that we should ban gay marriage, who agree that we should do away with guns, and who support Kerry in everything he does. The other 1000 or so agree with everything Liberals agree with. I find it hard to get anyone to agree with me, no matter what evidence I provide. to me, political ads are useless. they usually talk about the opponent's shady past and never addresses the plans of the advertising candidate. would a guy with a totally uneventful background make a better president than someone that is active and gets invovled with stuff, even if it can be used against him? how is kerry's veteran record going to affect our country more than his foreign or tax policy if he gets elected? how is bush's drug use past going to affect our country more than his military actions in the middle east if he gets reelected? the stuff that the politcal ads address are nothing more than that: political gimmicks to suck in the masses. after election, those issues never matter until the next election. its utterly stupid, whether they are true or not

I have a subscription, but I haven't got it yet. Even if they have proved 4 wrong, the SBVFT have proved Kerry wrong in at least 3 instances.

 
 And they are being challenged by people who don't support Kerry but support the truth. Also, they are being lead by a liar himself, as well as hiring the same guys who went after McCain, not to mention having a major who said he lied when he participated in unfit for command. I don't doubt Kerry lied, but these guys are scum. O'neill got his butt kicked by Kerry in a debate and was hired by Nixon to specifically go after Kerry, so his own credibility is seriously in question. The whole thing reeks of dirty politics. It seems most of them are simply out to get Kerry for what he said AFTER the war, and lying about what happened during the war doesn't seem to bother them. 
 
 
So they are telling some truth. I'm sure all of what they're saying isn't true, but I'm also very certain that some of it is. You seem to have avoided skylopps questions about MoveOn.org's ads.

Therefore with no expierence of these ads I cannot make a call on what I have no knowledge of. You seem to have ignored that. 
 
 
I agree that all of these 527 groups should either be eliminated or have certain restrictions imposed upon them. But I just think that the Kerry campaign is being a little hypocritical.

 
 I think all ads that run should be approved by the candidate(s). Then we can smack them for improper behavior and false claims. 
 
 
MoveOn.org has been bashing Bush and all Republicans for over a year, equating Bush to Hitler, trying to get Bush censured, and trying to get Rumsfeld fired.

 
 Rummy probably should get fired. Check out the new abuse report, and you'll understand why. I haven't seen a single moveon.org ad. 
 
 
I don't know if you agree with this or not, but making an ad that equated Bush with Hitler (which has no substance base at all) is much worse than a SBVFT ad that we at least know has some substance base.

 
 While Bush does have some facist senses to some of his policies (along with what he has said), it is a exegeration. However, the SBVT claims are based entirely upon 30 year old fuzzy memory. That in itself should make you question the entire campagin. At least the attacks on Bush about his service record actually deal with records. The attacks on Kerry are all circumstantial. 
 
 

 And what do you think the motives of MoveOn.org are?

 
 To remove Bush from office by highlighting his policy failures. 
 
 As for cherry picking, you REALLY don't want to accuse Kerry of doing that while supporting Bush. The whole science thing and Bush is a key example of Bush's cherry picking and outright lying.
